name: Space Scoundrel
txt: Space Scoundrel is a third-person shooting game of the 'Action Roguelike' style, in which the player takes on the role of a space pirate whose goal is to board a ship and take all its loot. The player will be able to explore a procedurally generated ship, where they will encounter different types of enemies and weapons to defend themselves.

The player's goal will be to navigate their way through the ship and survive until they reach the control room to be able to take control of the ship and complete the game. If the player dies, they will have to start over from the beginning in a new procedurally generated dungeon.

My main roles in this project were to be the systems designer and programmer for the dungeon generation system, weapons, character, and enemies. I therefore created a dungeon generation system that takes room prefabs and creates a path on a grid based on the desired size. I also created a weapons system that all have different statistics, providing varied gameplay for the player depending on the weapon they choose to use. The biggest challenge of this project was definitely the enemy system, as I had little experience with state machines, so I had to do a lot of research on the subject to understand how they work. This part of the project took the most time, but I think I got a good result for a first experience.
I am very proud of the outcome of this project, it has become the most extensive project I have done to date.
This project was developed by a team of 2 people and took 6 weeks.

name: Petit Héros
txt: Petit Héros is an action-adventure style game greatly inspired by the EarthBound game series for its graphic and adventure styles. In this game, the player takes on the role of a child who must save the world from the Black Lady, a demonic entity that wants to take control of the earth. This child also has the power to enter a fantastic world to complete their quest, and all elements of the real world are transformed.

This project was developed by a team of 6 people over a period of about 6 weeks. My main responsibilities were to draw all the tiles used to build the levels, draw the enemies and their animations, and draw various decorative elements. I also served as a level designer in this project, and my goal was to build the different levels so that they were interesting in both the normal and imaginary worlds.

This was the biggest challenge for me during this project because the imaginary world is much more attractive and interesting to explore. The challenge was to make the normal world just as attractive by placing different interactions, NPCs, and objects in the world that have a different outcome depending on the world we are in.

name: Last Spark
txt: Last Spark is a rogue-like action/adventure game with a constant ominous presence. The player must manage to survive as long as possible and must find multiple mini-bosses to then defeat the final boss.
This project was created by a team of 3 people over the span of a CEGEP session.
We have also created a website for the game that serves as a platform on which the game is available for download.

We had to give an aesthetic similar to that of the game on the site. So we decided to choose colors that contrast very well to give a dark and mysterious effect. We have also put a particle effect and subtle images of the enemies of the game to remind the elements that the player can find while playing.
txtPhotos1: Main screen of the game, here the player can start playing, see the instructions and exit the game.
The menu allows you to exit to the main menu or to quit the game.
The inventory system allows you to equip weapons and powers and organize the items obtained during the game.
Help screens will appear during the game to explain the different mechanics to the player.
txtPhotos2: The campfire acts as a player's safezone and can interact with the fire to heal and craft.
The player can find ruins in the game which gives access to upgrades, weapons and a spell.
Example of a boss fight. Bosses and enemies have more and more lives as the game progresses.

name: Escape the Nightwell Keep
txt: This project is a short platformer game in which the player has to explore the environment to find the castle’s exit while trying to dodge the multiple traps and enemies who are roaming inside.
This game is heavily inspired by the dark fantasy theme and games like Dead cells and Blasphemous.
txtPhotos2: Death screen, the player can quit the game or restart from the last checkpoint.
End game screen, gives the player the total of points he got and gives him the choice to quit the game or to replay it.

name: Règne de Malheurs
txt: To say that the Baron Van Der Brayne is unlucky is a hell of an understatement! Hit by a birth curse, his brain is perpetually in the grip of an influx of emotions that affect his decision-making.

Embody one of his 5 emotions: (Fear, Anger, Sadness, Euphoria, or Disgust) and control their reactions to events, each more traumatic than the next ! Your goal is simple, be the dominant emotion and crush your opponents !
Take control of the Baron's brain and rule his lands ! But beware, he does do not intend to let you take control so easily...

name: Repair 'n' Despair
txt: An alarm is ringing as you emerge from your cryostasis ... You come to your senses and understand with horror that your ship has been stormed by an alien !
It's starting to destroy your ship, and you're going to have to stop him and toss him into the void before he blows everything up!
You take a look at your oxygen reserves ...
You only have 20 minutes left before you perish from suffocation!
Repair ‘n’ Despair is a co-op game for 4 players.
You must repair the destroyed areas in order to restart the system and eliminate the monster before the oxygen reserves are depleted for good.
